prompt:
How can I write an introduction for my book that will capture readers' attention?
An effective introduction should intrigue readers, set expectations, and provide a clear context for the story ahead. It can include engaging hooks such as provocative questions, vivid descriptions of setting or characters, and/or brief summaries of major plot points. An example could be: "Imagine a world where time has stopped but people continue to live, ageing forever. In this frozen reality, a young woman named Amelia discovers she can manipulate time itself... What will she do with this power?"
